MINDdroid is LEGO® interactive remote control application for LEGO® MINDSTORMS® NXT robots.
 With direct BlueTooth connection MINDdroid is using built-in accelerometer and tilt sensors on your Android devices to drive your LEGO robot around.
 No computer or programming is needed as MINDdroid Universal Uploader enables you to upload files directly from your phone to your robot and run them instantly.
Please make sure that your NXT robot has BlueTooth on and it is paired to your phone or a tablet beforehand.
 In the menu the left button enables you to connect to your NXT robot model. It takes about 2-3 seconds to connect and you are ready to play well...

It interacts in a real-time with NXT robot models built to drive and shoot or drive and throw or drive and hit or just drive. By tilting your mobile device down it moves forward. Tilting it up makes your NXT robot model move in the opposite direction or backwards.
Twisting your hand to the left, it will make your NXT robot turn left and if you twist right - it will turn right. It is easy.

It has an Action button and when shortly pressed triggers the motor dedicated for doing simple tasks. For the Shooterbot and the Tribot it drives the motor 180° forward and back and for the Robogator the mouth will open and close three times. Isn\'t that cool?\n You can reverse action by pressing the Action button somewhat longer. It works really well with the easy-to-build starter model Shooterbot, the 8527 Tribot and the Robogator from the LEGO MINDSTORMS building instructions. Just select your robot type via the menu button on your Android phone when you are on the Tutorial-Start screen.

With the help of advanced firmware for NXT - leJOS NXJ (see http://www.lejos.org) you will be able to control other robot models like our famed AlphaRex. With leJOS in place of original LEGO firmware you can have read-out of UltraSonic sensor,reading the distance between your NXT robot and an object or a wall, Your robot can also recognize colors and can read them out aloud to you via speaker on your phone.
 Best of all, you can upload files directly from your phone or tablet to your NXT robot and start them remotely. Last but not the least, we supplied two (2) .nxj files - AlphaRex and MINDGameZ, and five (5) .rxe files - Pong, NXTCounter, Block, LineFollower, Robogator. With those files you can have at an instant hours of fun with your NXT robot.
 You can start those via Menu -> Start Program button. You can stop only AlphaRex and MINDGameZ programs in leJOS firmware by pressing the Menu -> Start Program for the second time.

 You will find printable tracks for MINDGameZ on http://mindstorms.com. But it could be fun to try to construct new tracks with a thick black marker on a huge sheet of paper or a black tape on the floor.

It indicates the direction you are tilting your hand-held device in and the direction your NXT robot moves. Short haptic feedback indicates that you just started driving around. Holding your phone flat in your palm will make NXT robot stand still. The more you tilt, the faster the NXT robot moves and the faster the square blinks. Cool, huh?

Because we can. And we think it is fun. Moreover, it will inspire you and many others to start building cool Applications for interacting with NXT robots and Android devices and even more cool LEGO MINDSTORMS robots. Because you can!\n\nNow go, try it out, have fun, play well and do not forget to visit us at http://mindstorms.com for more news, info and upcoming apps and goodies.
